title: Toddler wounded in apparent accidental shooting
content:
A toddler was shot Tuesday night in the 300 block of Huntlee Drive in Algiers (Jan. 26) when a gun discharged while it was being cleaned, the NOPD reported.
The 3-year-old boy was taken to a nearby Winn-Dixie grocery in the 3000 block of Holiday Drive in Algiers where a deputy was working, police said.
The child was taken to a hospital by ambulance and his condition was not immediately known.
Police are questioning the man who was cleaning the gun when it went off.
Police told a man to wait inside a Hyundai sedan in the Winn-Dixie parking lot until crime lab technicians arrived. They did so at about 9:15 p.m. and shortly after assisted the man in removing a young girl from the back seat.
Police spokesman Garry Flot confirmed the car in the parking lot is the one that brought the injured child to Winn Dixie. He declined to say who the man and girl were in relation to the victim or the man being questioned.
Police investigators had not roped off any portion of Huntlee Drive around 10 p.m., but they congregated around a one-story home with the front door open and porch light turned on. A man who answered the door one house over said he isn't very familiar with the young family that moved in next to him a few months back.
But the man and woman seem like "very loving parents," said the neighbor, who preferred to be identified only as Bruno.
"All I know is they bend over backwards playing with that little boy," he said.
Stay with NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune as more information becomes available on this breaking story.
